description: From Latin hebdomadƒÅlis.  According to the Poly-Olbion project, coined by John Selden in 1612.

adjectives.description: hebdomadal (comparative more hebdomadal, superlative most hebdomadal)

examples: They quickly weary of this brief hebdomadal Sabbath here, yet they long for that etermal one; they dream of it, they talk about it, they think they think they are going to enjoy it ...
